title: West Coast Servers Lagging
body: Anyone else dealing with west coast servers jumping to 250 ping and staying there for a while? For the past few weeks now, I've been playing with regular 69 ms, and out of nowhere it spikes to 500 then drops to 250 and fluctuates around there for a few hours. It rarely drops down to regular, but if it does, it's only a short amount of time before it jumps back up to 250-270. Anyone know if they're going to be doing some maintenance anytime soon?

replies.body:
Bump.

I too have been having similar issues.  Some times the servers work just fine, other times the game lag spikes so hard it's virtually unplayable.  Before I go into Ranked I play a game of ARAM just to see if the servers are going to cooperate at that time, and if they aren't then I just have to not play League (which sucks because generally I plan time to play League, so when it's not working that's a huge bummer).  I've done all the things on the recommended Support Page, and it's not my internet (during a lag spike session I did a Speed Test, I had 64 mbps connection with no latency issues), so it must be something with League, I presume on their Server side, because as I said some times it's perfectly fine, other times unplayably laggy.

> [{quoted}](name=Archgoose,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=aoOPkYZB,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-08-30T03:52:21.811+0000)

> Bump.
> 
> I too have been having similar issues.  Some times the servers work just fine, other times the game lag spikes so hard it's virtually unplayable.  Before I go into Ranked I play a game of ARAM just to see if the servers are going to cooperate at that time, and if they aren't then I just have to not play League (which sucks because generally I plan time to play League, so when it's not working that's a huge bummer).  I've done all the things on the recommended Support Page, and it's not my internet (during a lag spike session I did a Speed Test, I had 64 mbps connection with no latency issues), so it must be something with League, I presume on their Server side, because as I said some times it's perfectly fine, other times unplayably laggy.

I have the Same issues on the east coast. Ping spikes to 300+ and i just cant move as i watch chaos unfold in front of me. Checked everything. This seems to be server side issues.
I'm having the same exact issue right now.

Because you've been seeing high latency for a few weeks, I suspect there may have been changes to your ISP routing that gets you to the server. To investigate into this, we can run a traceroute log which will give us an in-depth view of your exact path to the servers.

You can run one with a networking app called [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/). After launching the app, run a traceroute with the IP address 104.160.131.1 for 5 minutes, then export the results and paste them here in a reply.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Happened to me too, except on the east coast. I am usually at a decent 40 ping, but tonight its been jacked up to 250 for the past 2 games, making the champs i play become unresponsive or delayed.  Its frustrating because i like hexakill but i work on weekends and I can't enjoy it before it ends tomorrow.{{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

Currently undergoing the same thing. At first I thought it might be the ISP one day, but it has been a couple days since the first time it happened (patch 6.17 release). Now I am currently pinging the riot servers using the command prompt. I was pinging 104.160.131.3 and it was running fine for a bit. Booted up a custom. 
Everything's good until about 6-7minutes in boom. Lag. Unmoveable. With Control+F it claims about 200ms, but it's more like 5000ms.
 Along with pretty severe packet loss (up to 7 in a row were lost with many others in similar "clumps")
I have never had this type of problem before I would LOVE a fix because I would like to enjoy an entire game of league with 0 lag, like the good ol' days of 6.16.
